column4: guys i upgraded my ubuntu, and now my menus are wacked, i have no more add remove software or anything, and my system is stable but useless, how can i get it to it's original state from the command line?
i am currently running the command, sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
well, actually, i installed edgy and put dapper sources in sources-lists, thats where the messup came in,
alt+f2, type gnome-terminal, tell me if you get anything
alt + f2 give me an error, Unable to load file '/usr/share/gnome/panel/glade/panel-run-dialog.glade'.
but i can get to a terminal though cwillu
ya, was just curious how broken it was
you're running dist-upgrade right now you said?
yes it's almost finished, will let you know what is up after a reboot?
better than I'd be able to right now;  let it finish and the ping me
ok its done, let me restart,
i still cant run alt+f2 though,
